summary: This is a press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the unsealing of an indictment against federal correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas. They are charged with falsifying records and conspiring to defraud the United States by failing to conduct mandated inmate checks at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on the night inmate Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide.

locations: Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the MCC
keyFacts: Correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas were indicted for falsifying records and conspiring to defraud the United States by failing to conduct mandated inmate checks at the MCC.
No correctional officer conducted any count or round of the Special Housing Unit from approximately 10:30 p.m. on August 9, 2019, until approximately 6:30 a.m. on August 10, 2019.
Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide by hanging himself in his cell during this period of no monitoring, and his body was discovered by Noel and Thomas at approximately 6:30 a.m. on August 10.

The indictment alleges Noel and Thomas, instead of performing checks, sat at their desk, browsed the internet, and moved around the common area, then signed false certifications attesting to completed counts.
Epstein had been placed in the SHU due to risk factors for suicidality and was in the cell closest to the officers' desk as a safety precaution.
